title: School Visit
description: Simulate a school visit to practice multi-audience engagement, policy explanation, and real-time dialogue with parents, staff, and students.
readingSummary: 1. Understanding your audience → Parents, staff, and students each have unique concerns.
2. Adapting your message → Tailor explanations to be age-appropriate, clear, and credible.
3. Maintaining composure → Respond to unexpected questions confidently and calmly.
- Local schools face safety and community issues.
- Parents are concerned about student well-being.
- Students are curious, playful, and often direct in their questions.

tasks.prompt: Parent Dialogue: Respond empathetically to a parent concerned about wild hog attacks and armed teachers.

characters.name: Linda
characters.concern: Local wild hog attacks, armed teachers

tasks.evaluation: AI evaluates clarity, empathy, authority, and tone.

tasks.evaluation: AI evaluates authority, clarity, strategic mediation, and messaging consistency.

tasks.prompt: Classroom Visit: Respond to 8–11-year-old students’ questions about safety and school environment in a playful, reassuring, and responsible manner.
tasks.evaluation: AI evaluates clarity, empathy, engagement, and age-appropriate messaging.

purpose: Practice communication with multiple stakeholders, balancing policy clarity with empathy, and demonstrating composure under live interaction scenarios.
